text: George David Raw (born 14 November 1944) is an English former first-class cricketer. Raw was born at Ossett in November 1944. He studied at St Catharine's College, Cambridge. While studying at Cambridge, he made his debut in first-class cricket for Cambridge University against Sussex at Fenner's in 1967. He made five further first-class appearances for Cambridge, the last of which coming in 1968 against Leicestershire. He scored 82 runs in his six matches, at an average of 8.20 and a high score of 21. In addition to playing first-class cricket, he also played minor counties cricket for Cambridgeshire in 1968, making eight appearances in the Minor Counties Championship. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:People from Ossett Category:Alumni of St Catharine's College, Cambridge Category:English cricketers Category:Cambridge University cricketers Category:Cambridgeshire cricketers
title: David Raw
